questions.question: Pepys finds Jane's account of the fire believable because she

choices.answer: is a reliable friend of the maid in the Pepys household
is a maid in his household whom Pepys knows well
heard the news from Betty Michell and Sarah, his good friend
has just come from the Tower of London

questions.question: When Pepys woke up about at about seven in the morning, he

choices.answer: thought the fire had abated and wasn't too concerned
was distressed that the fire had spread so quickly
rushed to the Tower of London to check on the fire
did not remember what Jane had told him about the fire

questions.question: Which of the following best describes Pepy's knowledge of London?

choices.answer: He was quite knowledgeable about different parts of London.
He had a superficial knowledge about various areas of London
He knew  about the areas in London where his friends lived
He had very little interest in the different parts of London

questions.question: Pepys's conversation with the Lieutenant of Tower

choices.answer: gave him an ally with whom to interview the disaster
made him decide to rush to see the king
relieved all his anxieties
confirmed his worst fears

questions.question: At the end of the selection from the diary, Pepy is at Whitehall. What most likely is Whitehall

choices.answer: a low-income section of London
the personal home of the Duke of York
an area with may government offices
London's community center

questions.question: The excerpt from Pepys's diary includes a factual recording of the fire as well as

choices.answer: the opinions of the Lieutenant of the Tower
a direct response from the king
the experiences of Betty Michell in the fire
the way Pepys felt about what he saw

questions.question: "The poor pigeons I perceive were loath to leave their houses" suggest what about his diary?

choices.answer: He did not want to write about human suffering
He thought he should not express anxiety about being burned.
He observed and recorded significant details about the fire.
He recorded only incidents confirmed by other observers.

questions.question: Which of the following is a strength of the organization of the diary?

choices.answer: Writing about the events, Pepys gave immediacy to the events
Pepys analyze their deeper meaning
Pepys showed the continuity of life in London
Pepys showed the effects of  natural world on civilized life

questions.question: What is a main reason readers find Pepys's account of the fire credible?

choices.answer: Pepys's diary is the only written account of the fire.
The king and Duke of York believed Pepy's account.
Pepys witnessed the fire firsthand from several locations.
Pepys obtained his information from credible sources

questions.question: What helps make Pepys's reaction when Jane awakens him to tell him about the fire credible?

choices.answer: He says that he went back to bed.
He admits that he underestimated the severity.
He realizes that the fire is not  dangerous as it was first
He indicates that the maid had stayed up all night

questions.question: What role does Pepys's recording of the observations of  people play in Pepys's credibility

choices.answer: It shows he found out about things he didn't see firsthand
It shows that his sources were important and well-connected
It shows  all his reactions were based on documented sources
It shows t the king and the aristocrats trusted his reports
